title: How COPs, the climate conferences accused of perpetuating inaction, can be reformed
summary: With still insufficient results, proposals are emerging to select the hosts of climate conferences, exclude fossil fuel lobbyists and move on to the practical implementation of agreements.

title: Tens of thousands in Lebanon head home as Israel-Hezbollah truce takes hold
summary: The road from the Lebanese capital to the south was jammed from before dawn on Wednesday with thousands of people heading home. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the truce in Lebanon would permit Israel to redirect its efforts back to Gaza, where it has been at war with Hamas since October last year.

title: Biden administration tells Ukraine to lower conscription age to 18: 'Manpower is the most vital need'
summary: Struggling to contain the Russian invasion launched in February 2022, Ukraine has already lowered the minimum age of mobilization from 27 to 25.

title: Trump transition rep says Cabinet picks, appointees were targeted by bomb threats
summary: White House spokesperson Saloni Sharma said President Biden had been briefed and the White House is in touch with federal law enforcement and Trump's transition team. Sharma said the president and his administration 'condemn threats of political violence.'

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs denied bail by third judge as he awaits sex trafficking trial
summary: Lawyers for the hip-hop mogul argued that a $50 million bail package they proposed would be sufficient to ensure Combs doesn't flee and doesn't try to intimidate prospective trial witnesses. Combs, 55, has pleaded not guilty to charges that he coerced and abused women for years, aided by associates and employees.

title: At the Musée d'arts de Nantes, the ocean liner as an object of fascination for the avant-garde modernist
summary: An elegant exhibition devoted to the role played by transatlantic ships in the rise of an international aesthetic.

title: Gilles Devers, a French lawyer and a leading pro-Palestinian figure before the international justice system, has died.
summary: The Lyon-based law expert died on November 26 after a long illness, five days after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was indicted by the ICC. His son, Manuel Devers, pledged to continue his fight.

title: The prosecution's closing arguments at Pelicot rape trial: 'By your verdict, you will signify that ordinary rape does not exist'
summary: After three days of closing arguments, the prosecution requested sentences ranging from 10 to 18 years' imprisonment for the defendants charged with rape. The maximum sentence of 20 years was requested on Monday for Dominique Pelicot alone.

title: France says 'immunities apply' to Netanyahu regarding ICC arrest warrant
summary: In a statement, the foreign ministry said France would 'respect its international obligations' but added that the Israeli leader was covered by immunity rules that apply to states that are not a party to the ICC.

title: France's left-wing coalition nears breaking point
summary: As the fall of Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government becomes more likely, the rift between the radical left and the Socialists is widening, while the Greens look on helplessly. The question of 'divorce' is becoming increasingly prominent.

title: Ceasefire in Lebanon takes effect after two months of open conflict between Israel and Hezbollah
summary: The agreement provides for a 60-day phase during which Israeli troops will evacuate the south of the country, in parallel with a withdrawal of Hezbollah forces north of the Litani River.

title: 'Presidential immunity, which Trump perceives as absolute, could lead to future impunity'
summary: In the United States, Trump's impunity implied by the transition will play as much a role in domestic affairs as in foreign relations, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: China has prepared for the shock of Trump's tariff threats, despite its vulnerabilities
summary: Since Donald Trump's first term in office, Beijing has improved its technological autonomy and diversified its markets. However, due to its heavy dependence on open global trade, China's economy remains vulnerable.

title: Jan-Werner Müller: 'Trump's victory is far-right populism, not pro-workers populism'
summary: The American billionaire's return to power is not the result of an immense revolt against the elites that would overwhelm the West, since he was brought to power by privileged voters, argues the political science professor in an op-ed.

title: Writer Boualem Sansal held in Algeria on charges of 'undermining integrity of national territory'
summary: The charges brought against the French-Algerian writer, who has been under arrest in Algeria since November 21, could be punished by life imprisonment.

title: The Sun as seen by Solar Orbiter
summary: The probe, piloted by the European Space Agency, has revealed images of the daytime star of unparalleled quality.

title: From the Musée d'Orsay to the Grand Palais, Nicolas Krief's mischievous eye
summary: From 2010 to 2023, photographer Nicolas Krief traveled to major French and European museums capturing moments visitors never see: the installation of an exhibition. His often mischievous images reveal the dialogue between works of art and those who handle them.

title: Trump's tariffs put Canada's trade at risk
summary: Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on Canadian products has caused panic in Ottawa. If the threat is implemented, Canada would have a lot to lose, as three-quarters of its exports are sent to the US.

title: Peanut the squirrel, US presidential campaign icon
summary: The rodent, a star on Instagram and euthanized for health reasons, is still making waves. Elon Musk has elevated it to a martyr of the administration's absurdities.

title: Trump tariff threats spur global jitters as the US President-elect touts 'wonderful' talk with Mexico
summary: Trump said on Monday that the tariffs on Mexico and Canada would only be removed when illegal immigration and drug trafficking to the United States are stopped, then he posted Wednesday evening on Truth Social that he had a 'wonderful conversation' with new Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, who in turn, called the call 'excellent.'

title: 'What people have liked in Trump is precisely that he was not in any way a role model'
summary: Jean-Yves Heurtebise, Doctor of Philosophy, in an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' considers that Donald Trump's return to power is a mark of 'nihilism,' signifying the entry into the era of the decivilization of morals.

title: In Donald Trump's sights, the great intertwining of the Mexican economy with the US
summary: For decades, along Mexico's 3,000-kilometer northern border, an ecosystem of factories and trade has been directly connected to the economic power of the US and its consumer base.
